instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

get green light, Vcore is present, but no boot, 

previously liquid damaged, ran through ultrasonic, 

replaced SMC thinking that might be the problem does same thing, doubt both SMCs have the same problem, 

Thanks in advance,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message: Beep without RAM? Internal 4 pin speaker must be connected. Vcore voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message:
No beep without RAM, internal speaker plugged in, 

Vcore voltage = 1.12

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message: Could be anything, where was liquid? Crap under SMC/PCH, <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message:
There was crap by <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>, also around SMC, both replaced, also a few other resistors around <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and around SMC, but still the same

thinking about calling this one quits,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Boot, FAN GOES FASTER! & FASTER!
threads.message: Corrosion under PCH, corroded trace/resistor, anything is possible in this case. Rabbit hole board :(
